meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sultry.
meanings.sent1: The sultrinesses of the summer made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the sultrinesses of the tropical climate as soon as I stepped off the plane.
meanings.sent3: The sultrinesses of the sauna were so intense that I felt like a melting ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: Her sultrinesses on the dance floor captivated everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sultrinesses of the desert sun beat down relentlessly on the travelers.

meanings.definition: The sultry or oppressively hot weather.
meanings.sent1: We sought refuge indoors from the sultrinesses of the midday sun.
meanings.sent2: The sultrinesses of the afternoon made us long for a cool breeze.
meanings.sent3: Despite the sultrinesses, they decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The sultrinesses of the heatwave felt like a heavy blanket draped over the city.
meanings.sent5: The sultrinesses of the summer storm brought relief after the sweltering day.
